meanings.sent1: The young boy was a quixote, always dreaming of building a spaceship to explore the stars.
meanings.sent2: She admired his determination, even though others saw him as a quixote with his big ideas.
meanings.sent3: The quixote in the story believed he could fly by flapping his arms like wings.
meanings.sent4: Her brother's quixote nature led him to attempt to build a time machine out of cardboard boxes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the quixote, tilting at windmills, has become a symbol of idealism.

meanings.definition: A person who is motivated by idealism and acts in pursuit of unreachable goals
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she remained a quixote, striving to make the world a better place.
meanings.sent2: The quixote's relentless pursuit of justice inspired those around him.
meanings.sent3: The young activist was a quixote, fighting for causes that seemed impossible to achieve.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of cynics, she stood out as a quixote, believing in the power of kindness.
meanings.sent5: His unwavering optimism marked him as a true quixote in the eyes of his friends.

meanings.definition: To act in a chivalrous or idealistic manner
meanings.sent1: He decided to quixote his way through life, always helping those in need.
meanings.sent2: She would often quixote by standing up for the underdog in any situation.
meanings.sent3: The knight vowed to quixote against injustice wherever he found it.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, she chose to quixote and remain true to her values.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged her students to quixote by treating others with respect and kindness.
